intro: Posoqueria laevis, commonly known as the smooth posoqueria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, and is characterized by its slender, unbranched trunk. The plant produces large, pinnately compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, and it produces edible fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
